page.title: 02FARMING IN OUR AREA
page.content: The breed of cow is a Friesian, but they cost more. An average price would be Â£500 each for a Friesian. While milking the cow, it has cake. In the summer the cow eats grass. In the winter the cow eats silage. The best age to buy a cow is when it has only had one calf. A cow lives up to 11 or 12. The cow is 8years when it has all its teeth. It only has 8 teeth. We store the oats, barley and wheat in big bins. When we want it, we auger it out of the bin and crush it up. The cattle like silage, fodder beet and maize indoors. In a pit put 100 loads of silage or maize. The calfs you can get in this area are hereford,jersey,friesian,belgian blues some people have them,limousins,and charolais. One farmer sells his milk, all the other farmers a milkman comes.
